snippet: Voters are being asked to approve an ambitious fix to Atlanta’s commuting problems that would raise $8.5 billion by adding a penny to the sales tax for 10 years.
abstract: Atlanta-area voters are being asked to approve an ambitious fix to the city's massive traffic and public transportation problems that would raise $8.5 billion by adding a penny to the state sales tax for 10 years; proposal, which bundles 157 projects in 10 counties, is part of a complex referendum that will allow voters across the state to decide whether they want a new tax for transportation specific to their region.
lead_paragraph: Voters are being asked to approve an ambitious fix to Atlanta’s commuting problems that would raise $8.5 billion by adding a penny to the sales tax for 10 years.

headline.seo: Atlanta-Area Residents to Vote on Tax for Transportation
headline.main: For Transit Relief, Congested Atlanta Ponders a Penny Tax
headline.print_headline: In Congested Atlanta, Tax Referendum Is Seen as a Shortcut to Transit Relief
